verses.verse: And I, brethren, could not speak to you as spiritual but as carnal, as infants in Christ.
I have fed you with milk, not solid food, for up to this point you were not able to bear it, nor are you able yet.
For you are still carnal, since there is envying, strife, and divisions among you. Aren't you carnal and living by human standards?
For when one says, "I follow Paul," and another, "I follow Apollos," aren't you carnal?
So who is Paul and who is Apollos but ministers by whom you believed, even as the Lord gave to each.
I have planted, Apollos watered, but God gave the growth.
So then neither is he who plants anything neither he who waters, but God who gives the growth.
Now he who plants, and he who waters are one, and everyone will receive his own reward according to his own labor.
For we are co-laborers with God; you are God's planting; you are God's building.
According to the grace of God, which was given to me, as a wise master builder, I have laid the foundation and another builds on it, but let every man beware how he builds on it.
For no man can lay any other foundation than that is laid that is Jesus Christ.
Now if any man builds on this foundation with gold, silver, precious stones, wood, hay, or stubble,
then every one's work will be clearly seen, for the day will expose it, because it will be revealed by fire, and the fire will test every one's work what quality it is.
If any man's work, which he has built on [the foundation] remains, he will receive a reward.
If any man's work will be burned down, he will suffer loss, yet he will be saved but as if through fire.
Don't you know that you are God's temple and that the Spirit of God lives in you?
If any one defiles the temple of God, God will destroy him, because the temple of God is holy, which you are.
Let no man deceive himself. If any one among you seems to be wise in this world's way, let him become a fool, so that he may be [truly] wise.
For this world's wisdom is foolishness with God, as is it written, "He takes the wise in their own craftiness."
And again, "The Lord knows the thoughts of the wise, that they are empty."
Therefore let no man glory in men, for everything is yours, [22] whether Paul, Apollos, Cephas, the world, life, death, things to present, or things to come--all are yours.
And you are Christ's, and Christ is God's.
